result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela C Roeglin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 23 days were granted.
May be transferred to Jefferson County.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Remainder of costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substance or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation and provide a copy to your Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight time, without work release, STAYED.
